meta.title: Idaho Department of Labor

meta.name: DESCRIPTION
meta.content: Idaho's home for job seekers and employers. Get help finding a job or finding employees.

ul.li: File a new claim / Reopen an existing claim.
Receive email updates on new resumes.

div.p: The federal CARES Act programs providing economic assistance to unemployed workers are being implemented in Idaho over the next few weeks. Find out more about these programs:

ul.li: Pandemic Unemployment Assistance - benefits to individuals who became unemployed because of COVID-19 and are not eligible for regular benefits.
Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation - temporary emergency increase of $600 per week on top of weekly benefit payment.
Pandemic Emergency Unemployment Compensation - adds an additional 13 weeks to a claimant’s unemployment benefits claim once they exhaust benefits.

div.p: Unemployment Insurance COVID-19 FAQs are updated frequently.
Visit our COVID-19 web page for more resources for job seekers, claimants and employers.
Find resources for help with food, shelter, mental health, child care and more.
If you have questions about Coronavirus, please visit coronavirus.idaho.gov.
Idaho’s home for job seekers and employers.

p.a: Free training in high-growth industries for qualifying youth 16-24.

li.a: Visit a Local Labor Office / Location

div.div:
Initial UI benefits claims*
*Week of April 12-18, 2020

div.a: See more Idaho Labor Market Statistics

h3.a: Labor Begins Making Payments for Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation

div.p: The Idaho Department of Labor has begun making more than $63 million in payments for the Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation program, which provides temporary emergency funds of $600 per week for claimants.

h3.a: Idaho’s Weekly Initial Claims Due to COVID-19 Exceed 100,000

div.p: Laid off Idaho workers filed 108,984 initial claims for unemployment benefits during the first five weeks of the COVID-19 state of emergency.

h3.a: Labor Department Releases Timeline for Implementing CARES Act Programs

div.p: Idahoans currently receiving unemployment insurance benefits could start seeing the additional $600 federal benefit authorized by Congress under the CARES Act by the end of April.
